section.title: About vi
section.para: The editor vi is installed on almost every Unix system in the world. Linux will very often install vim (Vi IMproved) which is very similar, but improved. Every Linux system administrator should know vi (or rather vim), because it is often an easy tool to solve problems.

Many unixes and linuxes will also have emacs, nano, pico, joe or other editors installed. The choice of favorite editor is often a cause for flame wars or polls. Feel free to use any of the alternatives to vi(m).

The vi editor is not intuitive to novices, but once you get to know it, vi becomes a very powerful application. Some basic commands are a A i I o O r x G 'n G' b w dw dd d0 d$ yw yy y0 y$ 3dd p P u U :w :q :w! :q! :wq ZZ :r :!cmd ':r !cmd' ddp yyp /pattern. Most Linux distributions will include the vimtutor which is a 45 minute lesson in vi.
